event.title: was formed from the Town of Western in 1811

data.event: The Town of Lee was formed from the Town of Western in 1811.

event.title: 1910, the Rome & Osceola Railroad was organized

data.event: About 1910, the Rome & Osceola Railroad was organized and the rails laid as far as Lee Center, with grading completed along much of the route, intended to carry timber from Tug Hill to a tie plant on the site of the Rite Aid warehouse on Rt 69 in Rome.

event.title: was born in Lee on Dec 16, 1837

data.event: George W. Kingsbury, for whom (with his brother), the county of Kingsbury, South Dakota, is named, was born in Lee on Dec 16, 1837.
